Localization

Character Strings

The easiest way is to define key-value pairs in a SXUL resource named text, then call shade_interface::gettext() to obtain a localized string. See get_name() function in the simple dialog sample project.

Using strings_interface may be more versatile. See how the plugin sets dialog titles in the simpledialog sample project.

SXUL files are always encoded in UTF-8.

Character encoding of Windows plugins build with 37xxxx SDK defaults to CP_OEMCP. Plugins build with 38xxxx SDK defaults to UTF-8 unless get_text_encoding() overrides it.

Controls

You can define controls such as push buttons and checkboxes in SXUL files and have windows load them.

See simplewindow and simpledialog targets for details.
